definition: a sensation of cold accompanied by shivering (as due to illness)
examples: He had caught a chill that night, and was now down with a fever.
If you have a cough, fever and chills and are not breathing as easily as usual, you might have a cold or the flu.
Over the next few days, my body followed up with a series of messages: you have a sore throat; you have a fever; you have the chills.

definition: an intense shivery sensation : shiver, shudder, one caused by a strong emotion (such as fear)
examples: Do you like a good scare? The sort of story, or moment, that sends a chill down your spine and makes the hair on your arms stand up like porcupine quills?
a song so beautiful it gives me chills
… this is where [Stephen] King shines, creating those aforementioned creepy scenes that gave me the chills.
When you venture outside on a cold day, chances are you feel the biggest chill in your fingers.

definition: a moderate but disagreeable degree of cold
a check to enthusiasm or warmth of feeling
examples: And a chill fell over the service as mourners … carried a casket draped in white to the altar.

definition: having a laid-back style or easy demeanor
examples: She looked just like Joey Potter … Really young and super chill. No one was paying any attention. It was a laid-back situation.
We're very casual. I love how at City Hall people come in everything from wedding gowns to jeans. It's so mellow and chill, just how we like it.

definition: to shiver or quake with or as if with cold
to become taken with a chill
to make cool especially without freezing
to affect as if with cold : dispirit
